recipe_name: Pan-fried lemon and chilli haddock with a herb salad
author: Gino D'Acampo
method: For the haddock, mix together the chilli powder, mixed spice, paprika, salt and freshly ground black pepper and rub the mixture into the fish.  Heat the olive oil in a frying pan and fry the haddock, skin-side down, for 2-3 minutes, or until golden-brown and crisp. Turn the fish over and cook for a further 1-2 minutes, or until the fish is golden-brown all over and cooked through. Finish with a squeeze of lemon juice.  To serve, place the mixed fresh herbs on a serving plate and place the fish on top. Garnish with the lemon half and a sprinkle of chilli powder.
ingredients: ½ tsp chilli powder,  ½ tsp mixed spice,  ½ tsp paprika,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  150g/5½oz fresh haddock fillet, cut into two pieces,  1 tbsp olive oil,  ½ lemon, juice only,  1 handful mixed fresh parsley leaves, fresh basil and fresh chives,  ½ lemon,  pinch chilli powder
